body_html: This is by design: if we do not wait for the notification, the callback may be called later and it will access memory (local variables captured in the callback) that has already been freed. The request and response objects are owned by the caller, which is the client in the LocalMaster case, but could be the gRPC runtime in other cases.
body_text: This is by design: if we do not wait for the notification, the callback may be called later and it will access memory (local variables captured in the callback) that has already been freed. The request and response objects are owned by the caller, which is the client in the LocalMaster case, but could be the gRPC runtime in other cases.
body: This is by design: if we do not wait for the notification, the callback may be called later and it will access memory (local variables captured in the callback) that has already been freed. The request and response objects are owned by the caller, which is the client in the `LocalMaster` case, but could be the gRPC runtime in other cases.
